macro.para: This macro delays the invocation of macro until the context introduced by is found.

Normal usage includes the invocation of this macro followed by the argument list to macro. For example,
#define MACRO(a, b, c) // ... (MACRO)(~, ~, ~)
If and when the context is found, this macro expands to a that contains an invocation of macro against the trailing arguments.
